owl:Ontology.dc1:termsdescription: Ontology for bridge components and their properties

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Fläche des abgedichteten Bereichs an.
Einheit in [m²]

Specifies the area of the used coating on a component.
Unit in [m²].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Abdichtungsfläche
coating area

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Dicke (Dichtungsschicht + Schutzschicht)
Einheit in [cm]

Thickness (sealing layer + protective layer)
Unit in [cm]
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Abdichtungsdicke
coating thickness

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Distance between the concrete surface and the outer edge of a reinforcing steel coated with concrete of a Component.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Betondeckung
concrete cover

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Kritische Temperatur für Lagerbauteile im Sommer an.
Einheit in [Celsius]

Specifies the critical temperature for a Bearing in summer.
Unit in [Celsius].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Citical Temperature Summer
Kritische Temperatur Sommer

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Kritische Temperatur für Lagerbauteile im Winter an.
Einheit in [Celsius]

Specifies the critical temperature for a Bearing in winter.
Unit in [Celsius].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Citical Temperature Winter
Kritische Temperatur Winter

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Diameter for round Component such as piles, pillars, etc.
Unit in [m].

Durchmesser für runde Bauobjekte wie z.B. Pfähle, Pfeiler, etc.
Einheit in [m].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Durchmesser
diameter

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Höhe eines Brückenbauteils an.
Einheit in [m].

Specifies the height of a bridge component.
Unit in [m].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Höhe
height

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Year on which the Component has been installed.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Einbaujahr
installation year

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Länge eines Brückenbauteils an.
Einheit in [m]

Specifies the length of a Component.
Unit in [m]
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Länge
length

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Defines whether a Component has contact with sea water
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: sea water contact

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Defines the tendon direction.
Gibt die Vorspannungsrichtung an.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Vorspannungsrichtung
tendon direction

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Defines whether a tendon is external or internal. True if the tendon is internal. False if the tendon is external.
Gibt an, ob Vorspannung extern oder intern verbaut ist. True bei interner Vorspannung und false bei externer Vorspannung.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Interne Vorspannung
internal tendon

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment: Gibt die Bezeichnung des Bauteiltyps an
Specifies the name of the component type.
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Typenbezeichnung
type specification

owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:comment:
Gibt die Breite eines Brückenbauteils an.
Einheit in [m].

Specifies the width of a bridge member.
Unit in [m].
owl:DatatypeProperty.rdfs:label: Breite
width

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Structural component that creates the transition between the bridge structure and the earth dam.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Abutment component
Widerlagerelement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Part of a Abutment on which a Bearing is installed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Auflagerbank eines Widerlagers
Benching of an abutment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Front wall of Abutment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Chamber wall of an abutment
Kammerwand eines Widerlagers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is aggregated in a Abutment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Abutment component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Abutment footing
Footing / foundation of Abutment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fundamentplatte eines Widerlagers

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Side wall of Abutment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fluegelwand eines Widerlagers
Wing wall of an abutment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: No clearly visible separation between the superstructure and the substructure . The arch of the bridge loads the transom diagonally outwards. Both vertical and horizontal forces are transmitted into it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Arch
Brückenbogen

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Natural or technically produced mixture of the binder bitumen and aggregates used in road construction for road pavements.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Asphalt

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Have the task of transferring the forces generated by their own weight, traffic loads and braking and wind forces to the substructure and abutments. A Bearing must be designed in such a way that it allows movements and rotations due to traffic, temperature differences, earthquakes, prestressing, shrinkage and creep, etc.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: bearing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component placed on the Bearing and serves to transfer forces over a larger area.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bearing seat
Lagersockel

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Components for protecting niches or interstices from birds.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Birds protection
Vogelschutz

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Steel cable that is installed on a Pylon and takes tensile loads from the superstructure.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cable
Seil

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component for anchoring steel cables of a bridge to Pylon.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cable anchoring device
Seilverankerung

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Non-traveled edge formation of reinforced concrete or prestressed concrete bridges, which can also be formed as kerbs.
caps have to fulfil various functions. In addition to protecting the load-bearing bridge structure, they are used for anchoring passive protective devices and as bicycle and/or pedestrian paths. Due to their exposed position, they are exposed to particularly strong attacks, e.g. frost-thaw salt attacks. In addition, there are dynamic loads caused by traffic on the bridges. Even if the bridge caps undergo optical changes as a result of wear, load or weathering during the planned service life, concrete bridge caps are safe and durable if constructive and technical rules are observed.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cap
Kappe

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Concrete components subjected to tensile stress.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Tension component as a concrete stay
Zugglieder aus Stahlbeton

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Separation lines within components. They occur, for example, in concrete construction as set-down joints between successive concreting sections. Concreting in several stages is often unavoidable due to the construction process. The aim is to create the best possible bond between the adjacent concreting sections. Since the reinforcement runs through the construction joints, a traditional shuttering of the concreting section with wood would be costly. Today, expanded metal is mostly used for this purpose, which can be easily cut and bent to size and guarantees a certain degree of interlocking of the concreting sections. If, for example, a straight line of joints is desired for aesthetic reasons, formwork panels can be used in combination with a reverse bending connection for the reinforcing irons, which allow subsequent interlocking by bending up the reinforcing bars as the concreting process continues. In engineering structures such as bridges, screw connections are used to connect the reinforcement steel over construction joints due to the higher loads.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Arbeitsfuge
Construction joint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Necessary in prestressed concrete construction if the component has to be constructed in several sections, e.g. in bridge construction. The individual components are coupled to each other at the coupling joints and the tendons are connected to each other, e.g. bolted, depending on the prestressing method
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Coupling joint
Koppelfuge

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Technical systems that counteract waterlogging on the bridge construction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Drainage
Entwaesserung

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Pile that is drilled to the underground by utilizing specifc drilling systems and machines.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bohrpfahl
Drilled pile

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bearings made of chloroprene rubber (CR) or natural rubber (NR).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Elastomeric bearings
Verformungslager

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Joint for interrupting components in order to prevent stress cracking.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dehnungs-/Bewegungsfuge
Expansion/movement joint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is installed during the finishing phase of the bridge construction after the shell construction phase (e.g. railing, bridge cap, etc.). Has no load-bearing capacity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Finishing Component
Ausbauelement einer Bruecke

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fixed bearing
Transmits vertical and horizontal forces from any direction.
Flat foundation which rests on the ground.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Footing
Gruendung

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component for the foundation of abutments and central supports and the transfer of bridge loads.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Foundation
Gruendungselement einer Bruecke

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is aggregated to the Foundation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Foundation component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Support beam used in construction. It is the main horizontal support of a structure which supports smaller beams. Girders often have an I-beam cross section composed of two load-bearing flanges separated by a stabilizing web, but may also have a box shape, Z shape, or other forms. A girder is commonly used to build bridges.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Girder

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bracing component aggregated in a Girder.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Aussteifung (stabfoermiges Component)
Bracing (bar-shaped component)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is aggregated in a Girder.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: girder
Brueckendeck (gesamter Querschnitt des Fahrbahntragwerks)

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Querbalken des Brueckendeckquerschnitts
cross girder of the bridge beam cross-section
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Cross girder
Querbalken

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Obere Platte des Brueckendeckquerschnitts
Upper plate of the bridge beam cross-section.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Brückenplatte
Deck

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Plate-shaped component used for bracing the Girder.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Stiffening diaphgragm
Versteifungsdiaphragma

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Lower plate of the bridge beam cross-section
Untere Platte des Brueckendeckquerschnitts
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Girder down plate
Unterplatte

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Balken in der Längsrichtung des Brückendeckquerschnitts
Girder component in longitudinal direction of the bridge beam cross-section
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Längsbalken
Main girder

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: "Girder segment" is a segment of a bridge deck, which can represent either a prefabrecated component or a section of the construction stage.
"Brueckendeckssegment" ist ein Segment von einem Brueckendeck, das ein Fertigteilkomponent bzw. ein Segment eines Betonierabschnitts abbildet.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Brueckendecksegment
Girder segment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that anchors the Foundation to the ground below.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Erdverankerung
Ground anchoring device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Technical system for illuminating the bridge mainly for traffic but also could be also installed for decorative effects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Beleuchtung
Illumination

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mixture of fine and coarse aggregates and bitumen that can be poured and spread during installation. Therefore, no compaction work is necessary when using mastic asphalt. Mastic asphalt is used as road surface, as floor covering and for waterproofing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gussasphalt
Bearing that transmits vertical forces and allows movements in at least one direction.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Components and technical systems for noise abatement and part of immission control. It is intended to ensure the well-being of humans and animals with regard to noise.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Laermschutz
Noise barrier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Part of a road intended for pedestrian traffic.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gehweg
Pavement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Components that support the ends of spans between these abutments.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pfeiler
Pier

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Rod-shaped component that reaches a certain depth into the soil and is connected to the Foundation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pfahl
Pile

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fixed bearings that allow tilting about any axis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Punktkipplager

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bearing that works on the following principle: A disc made of high-quality natural rubber (elastomer) is enclosed on all sides in a steel pot. Under high pressure, the elastomer behaves like a liquid and, thanks to its deformability, can be tilted about any horizontal axis.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pot bearings
Topflager

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Finished parts made of raw materials or semi-finished products that can be used for construction without further processing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fertigteil
Prefabricated component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In bridge construction, the high towering component over which the suspension cables of suspension bridges run or to which the stay cables of cable-stayed bridges are anchored.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Pylon
Tower/pylon

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component for the fall protection of persons, which is often installed at the edge of the pavement.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Geländer
Railing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Serves as reinforcement of reinforced concrete components and is cast with concrete after installation in the formwork.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bewehrungsstab
Reinforcing bar

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Composite component that is aggregated in concrete components to increase their load-bearing capacity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bewehrungselement einer Bruecke
Reinforcing Component

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Wire mesh made of welded bars of reinforcing steel, which are used for the reinforcement of flat reinforced concrete components.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bewehrungsmatte
Reinforcing mesh

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fixed bearing that only allows tilting movements around the bearing axis (one-sided tilting). They are only suitable if no significant tilting movements are to be expected across the bridge axis; i.e. for straight or slightly curved bridges with small bearing spacings as well as rigid cross members and rigid piers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Linienkipplager
Rocker bearing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One-sided movable Bearings which allow one-sided tilting. They have a limited use like the line tilting bearings. One or more cylindrical rollers are located between the plane-parallel surfaces of the upper and lower bearing plates. In the standard version with one roller, tilting around the roller axis is possible. It is possible to transmit horizontal forces perpendicular to the direction of movement. Since the direction of movement must be perpendicular to the tilting direction, they are not suitable for inclined bridges.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Rollenlager
Roller bearing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Protective device made of wood, concrete, asphalt or steel for securing road users or workplaces on or near roads.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Safety kerb
Schrammbord

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In the case of sliding bearings movable on one side, 2 guide pads with austenitic sheet steel are attached to the sliding plate. They transmit the horizontal forces via embedded PTFE to the upper bearing plate.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Gleitlager
Sliding bearings

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bearing thatenables the displacement and sliding movement in a flat and a curved sliding surface between the steel bearing plates. Spherical bearings generally act as biaxially displaceable pin bearings.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Kalottenlager
Spherical bearings

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is contained in the BridgeSubStructure zone.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Substructure Element
Unterbauelement einer Bruecke

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component that is contained in the BridgeSuperStructure zone.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bridge superstructure element
Ueberbauelement

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Component made of high-strength steel, which is mainly used for prestressing in prestressed concrete construction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Spannglied
Tendon

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The task of the TendonAnchoringDevice is to transfer the forces of the tendon to the concrete. This is usually done with anchor plates to which the prestressing steel transmits the forces through wedge anchoring, upset heads or nuts.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Spanngliedverankerung
Tendon anchoring device

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Tension component of superstructure
Zugglied des Ueberbaus
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Tension component
Zugglied

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Road components to clarify traffic guidance for road users.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Leiteinrichtung
Traffic barrier
